The of the (two-sided) ideals of any ring $R$ has following properties:

1.  $(0)\mathfrak{a = a}(0) = (0)$

2.  $\mathfrak{(ab)c = a(bc)}$

3.  $\mathfrak{a(b+c) = ab+ac, \quad (a+b)c = ac+bc}$

4.  If $R$ has a unity, then
    $R\mathfrak{a} = \mathfrak{a}R = \mathfrak{a}$

5.  If $R$ is commutative, then $\mathfrak{ab = ba}$

6.  $\mathfrak{ab \subseteq a\cap b}$

7.  $\mathfrak{a(b\cap c) \subseteq ab\cap ac}$

8.  $\mathfrak{a\subseteq b\quad\Rightarrow\quad ac\subseteq bc}$

**Remark.** The properties 1, 2, 3, 4 together with the properties
$$\mathfrak{(a+b)+c = a+(b+c),\qquad a+b = b+a,\qquad a}+(0) = \mathfrak{a}$$
of the ideal addition make the set $A$ of all ideals of $R$ to a
